SEARCH

Class File

java.lang.Object
File
public class File extends Object
A class representing a single file that has a name, a size, a creation time, a modification time and a writeability.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Vincent Van Schependom, Flor De Meulemeester, Arne Claerhout
Invariants:
The size of a file is always greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to the defined maximum size. 
isValidSize(getSize())

  • Constructor Details

    • File

      public File(String name, int size, boolean writeable) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs an object with a given (legal) name, size and writeability.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file.
      size - The size of the file.
      writeable - The writeability of the file.
      Preconditions:
      The size must be a legal size, i.e. a positive number, smaller than or equal to the maximum size. 
      canHaveAsSize(size)
      Postconditions:
      The name of the file is set to the parameter name. 
      this.getName() == name
      The size of the file is set to the parameter size. 
      this.getSize() == size
      The creation time of the file is set to the current time. 
      this.getCreationTime() == new Date()
      The writeability of the file is set to the parameter writeable. 
      this.isWriteable() == writeable

    • File

      public File(String name)
      Constructs an object with a given name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file.
      Effects:
      A new object of the class File is created with the given parameter name, the size is set to 0 and the writeability is set to true. 
      this(name, 0, true)

  • Method Details

    • isWriteable

      public boolean isWriteable()
      A method for checking if the file is writeable.
      Returns:
      True if the file is writeable.
      False if the file is not writeable.

    • setWriteable

      public void setWriteable(boolean writeable)
      A method for setting the writeability of the file.
      Parameters:
      writeable - The writeability to be set, either true or false.
      Postconditions:
      The writeability of the file is set to the parameter writeable. 
      new.isWriteable() == writeable

    • getSize

      @Basic public int getSize()
      A method for getting the file size.
      Returns:
      The size of the file.

    • canHaveAsSize

      @Raw public boolean canHaveAsSize(int size)
      Check whether this file can have a given number as its size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size to check.
      Returns:
      True if and only if the size is greater than or equal to 0, and if the size is less than or equal to the maximum size. 
      result == (size >= 0) && (size <= MAX_SIZE)

    • enlarge

      public void enlarge(int amountOfBits) throws NotAuthorizedException
      A method for increasing the file size with a given positive amount of bits.
      Parameters:
      amountOfBits - The amount of bits we want to increase the file size with.
      Throws:
      NotAuthorizedException - The file is not writeable. 
      !isWriteable()
      Preconditions:
      The amountOfBits must be a positive number. 
      amountOfBits > 0
      The current size of the file, increased with the positive amountOfBits, must not cause overflow. 
      getSize() <= Integer.MAX_VALUE - amountOfBits
      The writeability of the file must be true. 
      isWriteable()
      The current size of the file, increased with the positive amountOfBits, must be a legal size. 
      canHaveAsSize(getSize() + amountOfBits)
      Effects:
      The new size of the file is set to the old size of the file, incremented with the parameter amountOfBits. 
      new.getSize() == this.getSize() + amountOfBits

    • shorten

      public void shorten(int amountOfBits) throws NotAuthorizedException
      A method for decreasing the file size with a given positive amount of bits.
      Parameters:
      amountOfBits - The amount of bits we want to decrease the file size with.
      Throws:
      NotAuthorizedException - The file is not writeable. 
      !isWriteable()
      Preconditions:
      The writeability of the file must be true. 
      isWriteable()
      The amountOfBits must be a positive number. 
      amountOfBits > 0
      The current size of the file, decreased with the positive amountOfBits parameter must be a legal size. 
      canHaveAsSize(getSize() - amountOfBits)
      Effects:
      The new size of the file is set to the old size of the file, decremented with the parameter amountOfBits. 
      new.getSize() == this.getSize() - amountOfBits

    • getName

      @Basic public String getName()
      A method for getting the name of the file.
      Returns:
      The name of the file.

    • changeName

      public void changeName(String newName) throws NotAuthorizedException
      A method for changing the name of the file.
      Parameters:
      newName - The new name for the file.
      Throws:
      NotAuthorizedException - The file is not writeable. 
      !isWriteable()
      Preconditions:
      The writeability of the file must be true. 
      isWriteable()
      Postconditions:
      The name of the file is changed to the parameter newName, only if it follows the guidelines. The name cannot be empty and must only contain letters, digits, periods (.), dashes (-) and underscores (_).
      The modification time of the file is set to the current time, if the name is changed.

    • getCreationTime

      @Basic @Immutable public Date getCreationTime()
      A method for getting the creation time of the file.
      Returns:
      The creation time of the file.

    • getModificationTime

      @Basic public Date getModificationTime()
      A method for getting the modification time of the file.
      Returns:
      The modification time of the file is returned, possibly null.

    • hasOverlappingUsagePeriod

      public boolean hasOverlappingUsagePeriod(File other)
      A method for checking if the file has an overlapping usage period with another file.
      Parameters:
      other - The file to be checked for overlapping usage period.
      Returns:
      False if either one of the files doesn't have a modification time.
      True if the usage periods of the two files overlap.
